summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons Institution Supplement (NYM - 6031.03C) establishing procedures for patient care, sick call, and urgent medical, dental, and psychiatric services at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. It details intake screening, emergency response, sick call processes, dental care, inmate copayment fees, and various medical statuses. The document is a standard operating procedure and does not mention any specific individuals or events related to the Epstein case.
locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center New York, New York
keyFacts: This is a standard BOP policy document (Institution Supplement NYM - 6031.03C) dated May 29, 2013, detailing healthcare procedures for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
The document outlines procedures for inmate intake screening, urgent care, sick call, dental services, and medical statuses (idle, convalescence, unassigned).
It establishes a $2 copayment fee for inmate-requested sick call visits, with exceptions for indigent inmates and certain types of care.
The document references standard BOP program statements and American Correctional Association standards, indicating it is a routine institutional policy.
No specific individuals, events, or incidents related to Jeffrey Epstein or his case are mentioned in this text.
